description.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to deliver safe and sustainable drinking water services to communities

Water supply - rural communities service delivery

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Government is improved to deliver safe and sustainable drinking water services to communities

description.narrative: Modeling of government's utility-based management model for rural communities is being extended to 8 additional communities to provide sustainable, safe water for about 30,000 people. The implementation of key guidance documentation for Water Safety planning (risk-based management of drinking water quality) in Ghana is still in progress, in spite of COVID 19 related constraints. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of milestones reached in development of implementation guidelines/tools on public private partnerships for HWTS (WSP at HH level)

actual.value: 2020:A draft HWTS- PSP Model and risk-based facilitators Guide are under review

title.narrative: Number of milestones reached in development of implementation guidelines/tools on public private partnerships for HWTS (WSP at HH level)

actual.value: 2020:Consultative processes for full adoption by MSWR are in prgress, though significantly slowed down by priority focus of government on the response to the COVID 19 outbreak

title.narrative: Number of milestones reached in development of implementation guidelines/tools on public private partnerships for HWTS (WSP at HH level)
Number of milestones reached on development of scale-up plan for sustainable rural water service models, including private sector participation

actual.value: 2019:Support was provided for initial implementation/ piloting of the utility management model as a strategic entry point to supporting the refinement of the model, based on an assessment/ evaluation. The lead government agency has tentatively indicated preference for the assessment of the model in 202

title.narrative: Water Safety Planning approach adopted for rural water services

actual.value: 2020:On hold until related field work can be safely carried out in the face of the COVID 19 outbreak.

title.narrative: Water Safety Planning approach adopted for rural water services

actual.value: 2020:Progress has been significanly constrained by dleays in field based activities (e.g. testing for refinement of tools).

title.narrative: Recommendations from a study to assess urban water supply services are endorsed by MSWR

actual.value: 2020:Draft Research Report is under review by government and other stakeholders for finalization and validation

title.narrative: Recommendations from a study to assess urban water supply services are endorsed by MSWR

actual.value: 2020:Funding was obtained in 2019 and trhe study was duly initiated
